{{Other persons|Don May}} '''Donald May''' (born February 22, 1929) is an [[United States|American]] [[actor]] best known for replacing [[Wayde Preston]] as the lead in the [[1957]] television series ''[[Colt .45 (TV series)|Colt .45]]''. May played "Sam Colt, Jr.," cousin to Preston's character Christopher Colt, and the program ran on the [[BBC]] under the title ''The Colt Cousins''. May also appeared in various films and TV shows between [[1956]] and [[1993]], including ''[[Hawaiian Eye]]'', ''[[Sugarfoot]]'', ''[[Cheyenne (TV series)|Cheyenne]]'', ''[[77 Sunset Strip]]'', ''[[The Tenderfoot (1964)|The Tenderfoot]]'' (1964) for [[Walt Disney]]'s ''[[Wonderful World of Color]]'', ''[[Surfside 6]]'', ''[[Follow Me, Boys!]]'', ''[[Bus Stop (TV series)|Bus Stop]]'', ''[[The Dukes of Hazzard]]'', and ''[[L.A. Law]]''. He was a regular on the 1960-1962 series [[The Roaring Twenties]]. He also appeared in [[soap opera]]s, including ''[[The Edge of Night]]'', in his most popular role as lawyer Adam Drake from 1967â1977, ''[[One Life to Live]]'' and ''[[Texas (TV series)|Texas]]''.
